description: Monitor for unexpected access to passwords and hashes stored in memory, processes must open a maps file in the /proc filesystem for the process being analyzed. This file is stored under the path /proc/\/maps, where the \ directory is the unique pid of the program being interrogated for such authentication data. The AuditD monitoring tool, which ships stock in many Linux distributions, can be used to watch for hostile processes opening this file in the proc file system, alerting on the pid, process name, and arguments of such programs. Analytic 1 - Unauthorized access to /proc filesystem. index=os sourcetype="linux_audit" command IN ("grep -E '^[0-9a-f-]* r' /proc/*/maps")
